alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 04 at 10:31PM CDT until July 05 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON...NORTHEASTERN SHAWNEE...POTTAWATOMIE... NEMAHA...JACKSON...BROWN AND SOUTHEASTERN MARSHALL COUNTIES... At 1031 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near White Cloud to 4 miles southwest of Whiting to 4 miles northwest of Belvue, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Holton, Hiawatha, Sabetha, Seneca, Horton, Valley Falls, Westmoreland, Blaine, Meriden, Onaga, Hoyt, Centralia, Axtell, Wetmore, Mayetta, Everest, Fairview, Robinson, Morrill and Emmett. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
